You know what? I'm not in a gabby mood right now. I've got a score to settle. He flips shut a suitcase filled with C-5 explosive, the same stuff we saw Pascal selling in the opening scene.
Seems like you're going a bit overboard.

No, just leaving myself plenty of margin for error. Goodbye, Dylan. With that, he walks out of the room. The Thin Man signals to the Henchmen. Two of them force Dylan to sit in one of the wooden deck chairs. Then, with the thick packing tape, they begin binding her arms to the arms of the chair. As they do:
I don't know why you bother.   I've already won.
Is that so?

Every moment I sit here is a moment I'm using to figure out how to take you down. In fact, this statement -- this one I'm making right here-- is just me stalling for time while I decide which of your goons I'm going to flatten first. (whispering)
It's gonna be the guy behind me. The Thin Man can't help but be amused. After all, there are six guards and one blonde -- who is now taped to a chair.
Really?
By the time your guys are firing, I'll be at about 180 on my reverse inverted 360, which will land me on Fat Boy there, as promised. (nods to the second guard)
He'll take the chair seat in the chin. (re: two others; very slowly)
Now... I'm warning both of you: I'm going to get you to shoot each other. I know. Cliche as that sounds. (then to the last two)
Last, you guys -- hell, I'll make something up. We'll have fun. The Thin Man smirks oh-so-confidently.
And what will you do to me?

You won't even be here. I mean, I don't want to tell you how to do your job, but you should've killed me by now. Because I already know that your people are onto my people, which means any moment now you're going to be called out to go and deal -- Suddenly the door flies open and --
Ah!   See?
We have intruders. With a glare to Dylan, the Thin Man follows him out.
Alex, dressed in a sexy bikini, emerges from the water and instantly takes out two guards.
NATALIE hang-glides into a courtyard, knocking out two henchmen as she does. Alex catches up with her, as Natalie pulls out a small scanner.
Bosley's close.
You find him.    I'll get Dylan. Natalie heads left.     Alex goes right.

Racing up the stairs, Natalie enters a round room with open windows on all sides. A gentle breeze stirs the curtains. There's an amazing 360 degree view, from hills to ocean. According to her scanner, Bosley should be here, but there's no one.
(yelling)
BOSLEY! Bosley, can you hear me?
Hearing her voice, the feral Bosley looks up.
Natalie!   Is that you?
She hears him. She keeps yelling -- so does he -- until they both realize that his room is above hers.
How do I get up to you?
There's a staircase. Look for a switch. She begins frantically checking the desk, the shelves, everything. Her cell phone RINGS.     She answers it.
Hello?... Pete, hi! How are you?
On break, Pete is talking on a pay phone.
I'm good. I just -- you said you wanted me to call.
Natalie keeps checking the shelves, looking for a secret switch.
I did. I do.    I mean, thank you for calling.
I'm not an insecure person or anything, and I've really enjoyed the very brief time we have spent together. Two GOONS race up the stairs into the office.   Natalie turns to face them.
I'm just wondering if it's something I said or did that's making this whole thing so weird between us. The Goons approach.
(into phone)
Can you hold on a sec? Hitting MUTE, Natalie kicks the chair behind her and dive under the desk. She comes up on the other side with a
electric cords attached. She backhands it into the goons, who jerk and twitch as electricity shoots through their bodies.
(un-muting)

One more sec. She re-mutes. With a roundhouse kick, she flattens one of the goons, WHACKS the other with the cell phone. The first goon charges at her, but she sidesteps at the last moment, leaving Goon One to hit Goon Two. Both men topple through the open window, falling. Yikes.
(un-muting)
Sorry about that.
Listen, is this a bad time?
No.   Not at all. She starts searching again for the switch.
You just sound distracted.
You know, work this week has been really busy. It's been hard to focus. BEHIND NATALIE, Vivian Wu reaches the top of the stairs. She moves stealthily. Natalie has no idea she's there.

See, the thing is, I'm not a full- time waitress. I should have been more up-front about that, it's just... At the last moment, Natalie catches a moving reflection in a shiny trophy. Turns to find Vivian Wu swinging an antique chair at her head. She ducks.    The chair SHATTERS the display case. Scrambling to get away, Natalie drops the phone.
Natalie, what was that?
(yelling to phone)
Everything's fine!

Hate to disagree. Vivian upends the desk, nearly crushing Natalie. Vivian jumps on top, ready to kick the shit out of our angel. As we probably suspected, Vivian Wu is one hell of a martial artist. Fortunately, so is Natalie. In their first series of blows, Vivian seems to have the upper hand, but Natalie rallies hard. Vivian surprises her with a floor-sweeping kick, knocking her down. Vivian grabs the phone off the floor.
Is this the famous Charlie?
(confused)
No, it's Pete. Vivian looks at the phone. Who the fuck cares?      She throws the phone out the open window. Getting up, Natalie stares her down, incredulity building to rage.

You bitch!   I like that guy. Mocking, Vivian wipes away a tear. Natalie lets forth a typhoon of fury, a full-out Mortal Kombat. Vivian is thrown back against the bookcase, where she knocks over a candlestick. That's the trigger for the bookcases to begin sinking into the floor. Circling around the room, each set of shelves drops to a different level, forming steps that lead to the upstairs room. As Natalie and Vivian continue to fight, Bosley sticks his head down from above, watching the brawl. Natalie is kicking ass.
(to Vivian)
Do you have any idea how difficult it is to find a quality man in Los Angeles? She slams Vivian into the wall.      Grabs her again, han around her head.
To be honest? Vivian suddenly leans forward and KISSES her, right on the lips.
I don't care. Natalie is surprised for a moment, which gives Vivian the chance to swing at her. She misses.
I can handle villainy. I can even handle super-villainy. (Vivian swings and misses again)
But what you did is just wrong.
She head-butts Vivian, knocking her out cold.   She throw the limp body on the floor. A beat, then Natalie looks up to see Bosley.
(suddenly chipper)
Hi, Bos! He waves.
From below, we hear SECURITY WHISTLES. The compound has b breached. Dylan looks at the six armed guards surrounding
Here we go. And now she does exactly what she told the Thin Man she'd She pitches forward, ducking her head so the chair's back crashes into the railing, tearing it off. She stands.

Okay, that part worked. The Guards FIRE -- but Dylan has already launched herself from the railing into that backflip, which lands her on the head of -- Fat Boy, flattening him bad, and smashing the rest of the chair into kindling. She grabs the wooden seat and whips it up, catching bullets from Guard #3 before flinging it like a Frisbee at Guard #2, nailing him right on the chin Quickly she stands again, between Guards #3 and 4.

Now, guys, I warned you. This is where you shoot each other. The two men scoff, disbelieving. Then Dylan does a head fake, both Guards panic, and fire, but Dylan drops, leavi each man a clear shot at the other. Both gape. Both fall. Just Guards #5 and 6 left.    Dylan's chair arms are stil taped to her forearms.
Okay, here's where we improvise. In a whirl, she overhead-chops Guard #5. Drives her right arm into his shoulder while swinging her left arm into the back of the Guard #6's head.

A few more blows, then both men fall. Now Dylan drops into a second chair, half-exhausted, half-amused with herself. Has one brief beat to take it all in, then -- Bosley steps onto the veranda, sees Dylan sitting in the chair. FROM HIS POINT OF VIEW: It looks like Dylan -- whose arms are still strapped to the arms of the first chair -- is taped to the chair she now sits in.
Oh my God, let me help you. Bosley hurries over, "freeing her." Amused, Dylan lets him. Natalie steps out from inside, pausing to KICK one guard who was starting to revive.
Knox, carrying the briefcase bomb, gets into his waiting helicopter, followed closely by the Thin Man.
Let's GO! The helicopter quick ascends, just as...
Damn!
run into the courtyard.
Don't worry, we'll get him.
You don't understand. He's got a pound of C-5 in that briefcase.
The question is, where's he headed?
Miami. The three angels turn to see Bosley, huffing and puffing his way into the courtyard.
The man Knox is trying to kill has two general admission tickets to the Duke- Maryland game at Miami Arena. He's going to blow up the arena and kill his target.
Not that I don't believe you, but how exactly do you know all this?
Because Angels, I was the one who purchased those tickets.
But Bosley, you HATE sports, why would you... (suddenly getting it)
You didn't buy them for yourself.
You bought them for... Bosley lowers his head.    Suddenly all the angels unders
They race out the courtyard, in hot pursuit.

Racing across the water, we find thong-clad BEACH BABES moving to a Latin beat. Art Deco buildings flank sun-kiss streets. The people are sexy, the daiquiris strong, and e night's a fiesta -- Welcome to MIAMI. Running down the street, towards Miami Arena, the three angels pass THREE OTHER WOMEN rollerblading by: JILL MONROE, SABRINA DUNCAN and KELLY GARRETT. Nothing is said, but a cool moment just happened.

The three Angels are running down a very long hallway. Their voices are the only sound that echoes off these walls, although there is a faint humming that grows loude as they approach two, metal fire doors.
What do you think he looks like?
Sixty, tall, well-built.
I always saw him as younger.
Definitely.   With black hair.
No, silver hair. And tan.
He's not George Hamilton.
He's outside a lot.
We'll know him when we see him, that's for sure.
IF we see him.
How hard can it be to spot Charlie? They slam into the doors, and we...

We reverse angle to reveal the inside of Miami Arena. The thing that hits us is the WALL OF SOUND, the noise made by twenty thousand people in a basketball induced frenzy. The next thing that hits us is the sheer magnitude of the job facing the Angels. Hard to spot? The crowd is one, enormous, teeming mass of brightly colored humanity.

Aw, shit. The game is in progress, Duke vs. North Carolina, and it' barn burner. A one point game with six minutes to go. BAL PLAYER pulls up and swishes a three pointer, Duke by two. The crowd goes apeshit.
The Angels huddle, yelling over the deafening noise of th crowd...
We have to split up!
I'll take the luxury boxes.
I'll take the mezzanine.
I got the floor. They split up. Dylan leads the charge down the loge secti blowing past the SECURITY WOMAN, who yells after her.
BEHIND THE RIM, COLLEGE PLAYER #2 pulls down a brick, sla home the rebound. The crowd ROARS.

JASON GIBBONS, famous movie star and North Carolina alumn pumps his fists in the air. His luxury box is loaded with fellow Tar Heels and nameless studio executives. He repeatedly high fives a Hollywood type in sunglasses and
Yes, yes! When suddenly, the door to the luxury box is flung open.
(yelling)
Charlie!? Charles Townsend! Jason whips around and locks eyes with Alex.
Alex?
Jason? (beat)
Shit. Realizing she has no time to explain, and that Charlie is in here, she turns and leaves.
ALEX!    Hey... While everyone watches, confused, Jason pushes his way through the box and follows Alex into the hall.
Dylan races past rows of seats, pissing off plenty of fan in the process. DYLAN
(looking everywhere) Charlie! Charlie!
in the stands.
scribble at their monitors. Natalie runs behind them, scanning the crowd. WHIP PANS, from ONE MAN to ANOTHER to ANOTHER. Stopping on a likely candidate...
Charlie?
Who?
counts down.    :60.   :59.    :58.
Alex bursts in.   It's a crowd of fifteen cocktail-drinki BUSINESS MEN. ALEX
Charles Townsend? Anybody, Charles Townsend? She ducks back into the hallway.
Alex walks out into the hallway, frustrated.     Then, miraculously, she spots him... KNOX. He walks out of one of the luxury boxes, holding a large, metal briefcase. He heads for the elevator.
immediately goes to intercept him, but...
Don't move.
It's the Thin Man, standing behind her, with a gun in her back.

You move, you say anything, I perforate you. Got it? Knox glances back at the Thin Man, nods to him.      Then gets in the elevator. The Thin Man starts edging Alex towards some emergency ex doors, gun still in her back. Alex is trying to think of escape, quickly. She knows that the second he gets her ou of this public space, he's gonna shoot her. The door gets closer and closer...
Alex?!   Jesus, what is going on? The Thin Man and Alex turn around to face Jason, who is sweaty and exasperated from chasing her.
Jason, hi, I... The Thin Man digs the gun deeper into her back.
Can I talk to you later?
No you can talk to me NOW. I want to know what the hell is going on. First, you disappear with no explanation, not even a goodbye.
I'm sorry, I...
Now, I see you here, but you're with some other guy.
Hey, movie star, do yourself a favor and get lost. Jason double takes.     He's not used to someone talking him like that.
Lemme guess.   You must be Charlie?
Jason, please...

No, no I'm sick of this shit. I'm sick of this asshole telling you what you can and can't do. And then, with no warning, he hauls off and punches the Thin Man. Now, Jason's just an actor, not an ass-kicking super detective, so his punch isn't all that great. In fact, it leaves Jason shaking his hand in pain. The Thin Man, a trickle of blood running from his lip, sm
That was stupid. First, he pops Jason right in the jaw. Jason stumbles backward, dazed. Then he reaches for his gun, in the process, loosening his grip on Alex...

Jason, get down! Alex spins out of the Thin Man's grasp and does a full roundhouse kick, knocking the gun out of the Thin Man's hands. The Thin Man immediately responds, throwing two quick punches, which Alex expertly blocks and then follow with a hitch-kick to the chin. Jason, dazed and confused, thinks he must be hallucinatin

What the hell is going on? What's going on is a world class ass-kicking, courtesy of girlfriend. While the action star watches in amazement, A unloads an arsenal of bad ass kung fu moves that would ma Jet Li green with envy. The Thin Man doesn't stand a chance. A flying side kick sends him stumbling backwards into the stairwell. We follow the fight...
... to the first landing. The Thin Man, battered and brui reaches down to his ankle holster to get his spare gun, b Alex is too fast for him. She stamps on his hand, then drops a knee to his throat.
Right now, just by leaning forward, I could crush your windpipe. You'd die a slow and painful death. You don't want that, do you?
The Thin Man shakes his head "no."
Where is the bomb, when's it going off? She presses harder.
Jason slams out into the stairwell, looking for Alex. He finds her on her walkie talkie, the Thin Man handcuffed to the staircase.
Hi, Jason.   Gimme one second? Jason nods, sure. We go to another triptych, all three Angels on their cell phones in different parts of arena.
Angels! Knox planted the bomb in the basement, and it's timed to go off when the game clock hits zero!
Roger that, Alex, I'll stop the clock!
I'll look for the bomb! Alex turns back to Jason. He's clearly having a difficult time processing everything he's just seen.
I lied to you Jason.    I'm not a secretary.
Yeah, I can see that.
(referring to the Thin Man)
And that wasn't Charlie.
Right.
I'm actually here to stop a madman from killing everyone in this building. Would it be okay if we talked later?
Go save the world, honey. (beat)
I'll be waiting for you. Alex smiles.    Runs off.
Natalie stares up at the clock... :30.       :29. The WHISTLE BLOWS.
Time out! Whew, that was close. But it'll start up any second. has to keep it stopped. But how? She glances to the sidelines and gets an idea.

MUSIC starts from overhead, the respective teams' cheerle coming out for one last routine. As they kick into gear, Natalie comes out with them, dres as a Duke cheerleader. She follows along with the dancers bit timid at first, then more confident as she gets into
Dylan races through the basement, looking for the briefca Then she spots it, hooked into some wires that snake up into ceiling above. Dylan approaches it cautiously.       She slowly opens th
(to herself)
Alright, Dylan, all we have to do is figure out which wire to cut.
there are about fifty different wires, in every color in the Crayola box.
Oh, shit.
Alex, still searching for Charlie, notices something stra
You're kidding me.
is fully transformed on the court, from wallflower to ful out cheerleader. It's not that she's as good as the other cheerleaders. She's better.

The SONG ends. The Cheerleaders vacate the court, but Nat keeps dancing her heart out. She has 18,000 fans watching her, and she's totally in the moment. But there's another agenda as well... COURTSIDE RADIO ANNOUNCER
The time out is over, but one cheerleader doesn't seem to notice. Officials can't start the clock again while she's on the court.
Dylan has picked two wires. DYLAN
Chartreuse and magenta.   This has gotta be it. She prepares to snip them with her wire cutters, when... KNOX (O.S.)
I wouldn't do that, if I were you. She spins to see Knox, standing behind her. KNOX (CONT'D)
See, if you snip ANY of those wires, the bomb WILL blow up. DYLAN
It's gonna blow anyway, once the clock gets to zero. KNOX

Who told you that, my idiotic henchman? Do you think I tell him ANYTHING that's confidential? He holds up a small TRIGGERING DEVICE. It's the same one we saw Pascal try to sell in the opening scene. KNOX (CONT'D)
THIS is what triggers that bomb.     So if you'll kindly step away, I'll refrain from killing both of us.
Realizing she has no choice, Dylan stands up and backs aw KNOX (CONT'D)
In different circumstances, Dylan, I think you and I could have worked out. We have a lot in common. DYLAN
Yeah, I fall for assholes, and you ARE one. Knox laughs. KNOX
Good one. (beat, as he backs up) Well, I must be going. If you like your body parts attached to your torso, I suggest you do the same. Knox turns to go, but the other Angels are blocking his w ALEX
Give it up, Knox. You're surrounded. NATALIE
Give us the detonator. KNOX
Stumbling backwards, Knox holds it up high. KNOX (CONT'D)
I'll blow this building sky high, I swear! CHARLIE (O.S.)
Don't do it, Eric. It's me you want, not all these innocent people. Everyone turns, as one, to a figure emerging from the sha KNOX

Charlie? That's right, it's Charlie. Finally, after all these year we get a look at him, and boy is it... disappointing. He's not what we expected. Short, portly, dressed in a "We're #1" t-shirt; the Angels are absolutely floored by Charlie's appearance. ANGELS
Charlie? Charlie ignores their stares and addresses Knox directly.
Your father was a double agent, Eric. Yes, I revealed him, but he was killed by his own people before we could throw him in jail. (beat)
He was my friend.
It's still your fault, you arrogant prick! You still killed my father!

Maybe. Maybe I did. But why should YOU kill all these people? If you hate me so much, just shoot ME. Just shoot me, Eric. Charlie spreads his arms, leaving Knox a plenty wide targ It's a horribly tense moment.       The Angels are frozen Knox decide Charlie's fate. Knox is sweating, debating his choices. Can he really do this? Charlie's not the glamorous, smug asshole he imagin He starts lowering his gun.
Okay.  You're right. (quickly)
I'll just kill you.

It all happens in the blink of an eye. Knox fires, hittin Charlie in the chest. Natalie leaps out and tackles Knox. Alex dives and grabs the detonator, before it has a chanc to go off. Dylan runs to Charlie's side.
Charlie, no.   NO! She hold shim in her arms as the other Angels gather roun their fallen leader. He gasps for air.

He's trying to say something. Then Dylan notices something weird. He's not gasping for air, there's something stuck in his mouth. With a great, hacking cough, he spits it out. It's a voic chip, like the one Dylan used in the opening scene.
Ucch, that tasted terrible! The voice isn't Charlie's. Dylan reaches down and rips off Charlie's mask, revealing...
Bosley!   Are you okay?
Think so. He pulls back the padding from the suit, revealing a smal wound where the bullet grazed his side.
Hurts, but it looks like it'll heel. Dylan laughs, Alex ruffles his hair.
Hey, wait a second. If Bosley's here... then where's Charlie? The Angels all look at each other.      No one knows.
In gorgeous SLOW MOTION, the three angels walk side-by-si with a calm assurance, fireballs exploding behind them. They won. As MUSIC rises, the ANGELS TRIPTYCH descends, then peels away to reveal...
The angels kick back on the white sands, tropical drinks hand. Bosley is there as well, with a grass hat and zinc on his sniffer. Charlie is on the cellular speakerphone.
Great work, angels. You'll be happy to know you received another presidential commendation. The Angels, and Bosley, clink glasses.
Enjoy your vacation, angels.
Thank you Charlie.
They toast the speakerphone.
Alex, Natalie -- I know you've been putting in some long hours on this case, so I thought you might enjoy a chance to catch up with some old friends.

head_text.subj: NATALIE AND ALEX TURN TO SEE

text: walking across the beach towards them. Each is carrying a drink of his own. They wave. Damn those men look good. Alex and Natalie share a smile.
Any chance you'll be joining us, Charlie?

We're in Charlie's point-of-view. We can see part of his reflection in the window -- not enough to see his face, but we get some sense of the man. He turns away, begins walking.    Steps down onto the san
(to cell phone)
I'd love to, Angels. But I have some precious treasures to watch over. With that, he hangs up. We stay in his P.O.V., walking across the beach. And it's not just any beach.

approaching.    We're on the same beach. Looking right, we see the backs of the Angels and Bosley. They have no idea that Charlie is walking right behind th A beat, then Dylan looks back. She looks directly as us -- at Charlie -- tracking as we move past. Does she somehow recognize it's Charlie? From her reaction, it's not clear. A beat, then we...
Dylan looks back forward again. Did she just see Charlie? Her smile tells us she thinks she did. She raises a toast.
To Charlie.

To Charlie. They knock glasses. Right at the moment we should probably fade out, Bosley spills his icy drink in his lap. His eyes go wide. The Angels just have to laugh. We FREEZE FRAME, then... CUT TO BLACK.
